task_summary: The robot is tasked with reaching a pink towel using visual perception, navigation, and alignment. The contact sheet shows approach and precise positioning by a bimanual arm.

task_long_description.overview: This episode shows a bimanual robotic arm locating and approaching a pink towel placed on a green mat. The robot begins by visually detecting the towel, adjusts its pose using high-precision movements, and finally arrives at the designated 'reach' position above the towel, constrained by stable alignment. No grasp or manipulation is performed; the goal is contactless arrival at the towel's position.
preconditions: Robot system is powered on and calibrated.
Towel is present and unobstructed on the workspace.
Visual sensors operational; workspace lighting suitable.
stepwise_plan: Check if the towel is visually detectable.
If not detected, execute scanning to locate the towel.
Detect the towel to obtain its position.
Move the end-effector above the towel at a safe height.
Approach and align to the towel with tight tolerance.
Verify the robot is at the towel position.
success_criteria: End-effector is precisely positioned above the towel.
failure_and_recovery: Towel not detected: retry scanning pattern.
Visual noise: repeat detection and alignment.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful alignment and verification above the towel.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the towel is observable in the robot's visual workspace.
Scans workspace to find the towel, using a grid pattern up to 3 times with 1200ms timeout.
Performs focused visual detection of the towel with up to 800ms timeout.
Moves the robot end-effector to a position 5cm above the towel, with timeout.
Final approach and alignment of the robot end-effector to the towel with tight tolerance (0.005).
Verifies that the robot is at the correct position above the towel.

recovery_strategy: Retry scanning and detection up to 3 times.
Repeat approach and alignment if position incorrect.
Abort and signal if towel is missing after retries.
assumptions: No grasp/manipulation required; task is contactless reaching, as indicated by frames (instruction is ambiguous, but frames show only positioning).
Towel is static and easily detectable; no occlusion present in the scene.
No force ports needed as no physical interaction or grasp is visible.

expected_success_criteria: End-effector reaches and aligns above the towel without disturbing it.
